DOC.brief_summary: Natalizumab is a humanized monoclonal antibody directed against Very Late Activation Antigene 4 (VLA-4) and has a potent effect on disease activity in multiple sclerosis (MS). A blockade of VLA-4 with natalizumab may not only interfere with autoimmunological processes but also with central nervous system (CNS) immune surveillance.
DOC.detailed_description: Longitudinal ex vivo and in vitro study to determine the effect of natalizumab on frequency of distinct immune cells and on the frequency and suppressive function of natural CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cells (Tregs).
DOC.criteria: relapsing remitting MS indication for natalizumab treatment other disease modifying agents within 2 weeks
